content.text:
# Vice-President of French Polynesia

Vice-President of French Polynesia (French: Vice-présidente de la Polynésie française) is a senior governmental position in French Polynesia. The office holder is appointed by the President of French Polynesia. Before the establishment of executive presidential office, in 1977 the office of vice president of the government council was established. The officeholders were Francis Sanford June 1977 - June 1982, and Gaston Flosse June 1982 - September 1984.
